title: ipi-rip
description: Data model for IPI RIP Configuration and Operational state

ipi-rip:rip.description: Top level container for Routing Information Protocol (RIP)

restart-grace-period.description: Use this attribute to configure grace period for rip graceful restart
Use this attribute to configure grace period for rip graceful restart

options.description: This attribute enables debugging for RIP
This attribute enables debugging for RIP

terminal-debug-status.description: This attribute describes the RIP terminal debug status

interfaces.description: Container for RIP interface related attributes

disable-receive-packet.description: Use this attribute to configure the interface to enable/disable the reception of RIP packets

disable-send-packet.description: Use this attribute to enable/disable sending RIP packets through current interface

receive-version.description: Use this attribute to receive specified version of RIP packets on an interface

send-version.description: Use this attribute to set the version of RIP packets which can be sent from an interface

auth-mode.description: Use this attrbute to set the type of authentication mode used for RIP packets

auth-string.description: Use this attribute to set the authentication string or password used by a key

auth-keychain.description: Use this attribute to enable RIP authentication on an interface and specify the name of the key chain to be used

split-horizon.description: Use this attribute to controls RIP split-horizon processing on the specified interface.

disable-receive-packet.description: Use this attribute to configure the interface to enable/disable the reception of RIP packets

disable-send-packet.description: Use this attribute to enable/disable sending RIP packets through current interface

receive-version.description: Use this attribute to receive specified version of RIP packets on an interface

send-version.description: Use this attribute to set the version of RIP packets which can be sent from an interface

auth-mode.description: Use this attrbute to set the type of authentication mode used for RIP packets

auth-string.description: Use this attribute to set the authentication string or password used by a key

auth-keychain.description: Use this attribute to enable RIP authentication on an interface and specify the name of the key chain to be used

split-horizon.description: Use this attribute to controls RIP split-horizon processing on the specified interface.

sent-mcast-updates.description: Counter for numbers of mcast route updates sent

sent-mcast-requests.description: The number of mcast requests sent by RIP

sent-unicast-updates.description: Counter for number of unicast route update sent

sent-unicast-requests.description: The number of unicast requests sent by RIP

received-mcast-updates.description: Counter for number mcast route updates received

received-mcast-requests.description: The number of mcast requests received by RIP

received-unicast-updates.description: Counter for number of unicast route updates received

received-unicast-requests.description: The number of unicast requests received by RIP

received-bad-packets.description: The number of RIP invalid packets received from this neighbor that were subsequently discarded for any reason

received-bad-routes.description: The number of routes received from this neighbor, in valid RIP packets that were ignored for any reason

enable-cisco-metric-behavior.description: Use this attribute to set metric updation behavior as Cisco

version.description: Use this attribute to set version of routing protocol

distance.description: Use this attribute to set administrative distance of the RIP for the current RIP instance

network-interfaces.description: Use this attribute to enable routing on an interface

network-routes.description: Use this attribute to enable routing on an IP network

rip-enabled.description: Use this attribute enable a RIP routing process

bfd-enable.description: This feature indicates that the RIP implementation on the system supports BFD

receive-buffer-size.description: Use this attribute to set the RIP UDP receive-buffer size.

passive-interfaces.description: Disables sending of RIP packets on the specified interface

static-routes.description: Use this attribute to set static RIP routes

timers.description: Enclosing container for settings of basic timers

route-table-update-interval.description: Interval at which RIP updates are sent

route-info-timeout-interval.description: Interval before a route is declared invalid after no updates are received

garbage-collection-interval.description: Interval before a route is flushed from the routing table

maximum-prefix.description: Enclosing container for the maximum-prefix container

max-routes.description: Use this attribute to set the limit of number of RIP routes in routing table

warning-threshold-percentage.description: Use this attribute to set the percentage of maximum routes to generate a warning
